AD_HalflingLamenting.synopsis: A trio of Rivington locals complain about the way their letters have been treated by the local post-office.
AD_HalflingLamenting.how_to_trigger: - go to 9.5;47.5; -20- The dialogue should start automatically.

MaleHalfling_0.speaker: Randalf
MaleHalfling_0.text: I'd suggest holding onto your letters until things get back to normal around here.

MaleHalfling_1.speaker: Randalf
MaleHalfling_1.text: Forgive me, but I must attend to my friend, she's most upset about... the post.
MaleHalfling_1.context: NodeContext: cocncerned but also embarassed by his friend

MaleDwarf_0.speaker: Balgor
MaleDwarf_0.text: The cultists are on our doorstep, but no - the 'real' problem is the bloody post.

MaleDwarf_1.speaker: Balgor
MaleDwarf_1.text: Do me a favour? Box my ears in. I can't listen to any more whining about 'missing letters'.

FemaleHalfling_0.speaker: Sylvie Summerworth
FemaleHalfling_0.text: Do not, under any circumstances, employ Sword Coast Couriers! Their service is appalling.

FemaleHalfling_1.speaker: Sylvie Summerworth
FemaleHalfling_1.text: I am this close to buying and training a pigeon to send my own post! Oh, now there's an idea...

AD_HalflingLamenting_7.speaker: Balgor
AD_HalflingLamenting_7.text: Instead of complaining to me, why don't you find a different delivery service?

AD_HalflingLamenting_4.speaker: Sylvie Summerworth
AD_HalflingLamenting_4.text: I checked - it's the Sword Coast Couriers or nothing. Can you believe it?

AD_HalflingLamenting_3.speaker: Balgor
AD_HalflingLamenting_3.text: I think that's what they call a monopoly.

AD_HalflingLamenting_8.speaker: Sylvie Summerworth
AD_HalflingLamenting_8.text: It's a racket, is what it is.

AD_HalflingLamenting_9.speaker: Sylvie Summerworth
AD_HalflingLamenting_9.text: 'To Send and to Serve', they say. Well I say poppycock! I cannot believe they lost my letters.

AD_HalflingLamenting_5.speaker: Randalf
AD_HalflingLamenting_5.text: I'm sure your letters will turn up - have patience.

AD_HalflingLamenting_6.speaker: Sylvie Summerworth
AD_HalflingLamenting_6.text: This is the third time in the last tenday!

AD_HalflingLamenting_1.speaker: Balgor
AD_HalflingLamenting_1.text: Maybe it has something to do with the army about to invade the city.

AD_HalflingLamenting_13.speaker: Sylvie Summerworth
AD_HalflingLamenting_13.text: Don't believe everything you read in the broadsheets. That so-called army is probably no more than a pack of goblins and bugbears.

AD_HalflingLamenting_11.speaker: Randalf
AD_HalflingLamenting_11.text: What did the postmaster say? Danzo, isn't it?

AD_HalflingLamenting_12.speaker: Sylvie Summerworth
AD_HalflingLamenting_12.text: He muttered a bunch of excuses, but I wasn't having it. He has one job - deliver my post. So do it!

AD_HalflingLamenting_0.speaker: Balgor
AD_HalflingLamenting_0.text: Actually, the pigeons do the delivering. Why don't you take your complaints to them?

AD_HalflingLamenting_2.speaker: Sylvie Summerworth
AD_HalflingLamenting_2.text: You know - that's an excellent idea! I should go straight to the source.

AD_HalflingLamenting_10.speaker: Balgor
AD_HalflingLamenting_10.text: Never thought I'd feel sorry for a flock of pigeons.
